title: Gallery Talk: Connoisseurship of Japanese Prints
hero_caption: Katsushika Hokusai. Under the Wave off Kanagawa (Kanagawa oki nami ura), also known as the Great Wave, from the series "Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji (Fugaku sanjurokkei)," 1825–1838. Clarence Buckingham Collection.
description:
Join museum educator Lucas Livingston as he explores the differences in production, quality, authenticity, and preservation of Japanese woodblock prints and examines questions around the collecting and appreciation of prints featured in Connoisseurship of Japanese Prints, an exhibition that focuses on multiple states and printings of the same images.

See also the Express Talk: Hokusai’s Great Wave on June 12 and June 19.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
